heaps

Interface MinHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Comparable type held by the MinHeap.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayMinHeap, LinkedMinHeap

    public interface MinHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>

    MinHeaps are complete binary search trees whose node contents are always smaller than the contents of their children nodes.

    You should not edit this interface! It is given to you as a resource for your project.

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    BinarySearchTree, LinkedMinHeap, ArrayMinHeap

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the MinHeap of all elements.
      T deleteMin()
      Returns and removes the minimum element from the MinHeap.
      T getMin()
      Returns, but does not remove, the minimum element of the MinHeap.
      void insert(T element)
      Add an element in the MinHeap.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Queries the MinHeap for emptiness.
      java.util.Iterator<T> iterator()
      MinHeaps are endowed with fail-fast Iterators which return the elements in ascending order.
      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in the MinHeap.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, spliterator
